description:
As a member of the Executive Communications team, you will be part of a small team which produces employee communications and events for Google executives. You will work with members of your internal client team on communications initiatives, projects and programs. You will support the work of the team to create strategic communications campaigns, come up with innovative ways to engage employees that are in tune with Google's culture, write communications, business update presentations and talking points. You will also collaborate with internal partners as needed across functions (PR, Policy, Legal, HR, Operations, etc.) and geographies.

As part of the YouTube Communications team, you will lead on all internal communication to and from YouTube’s Engineering, Product, UX organizations. You will also develop communications strategies and produce communications for YouTube’s tech leadership. Additionally, you will collaborate with cross functional teams (e.g., Marketing, PR, Policy, HR) to develop and deliver messaging on complex, nuanced issues, providing advice for leadership that reflects a deep understanding of their business priorities and leadership style. In this role, you will coordinate content and speakers for strategic internal events, represent YouTube tech to all of Google internally, and help drive forward YouTube’s culture and business strategy by inspiring and aligning the team around YouTube’s mission, values, and objectives.

It's our job to help inform and educate users, advertisers, partners, opinion leaders--and our own employees--about the benefits of Google's products, our distinctive company culture/values, and our approach to the big public policy issues of the day. We are looking for quick-witted, entrepreneurial and intellectually curious people to join the team. To succeed here, you'll need to be able to combine creativity with the organizational skills to manage numerous different projects to tight deadlines simultaneously, as well as enjoy pitching to all kinds of journalists, bloggers and commentators (we find it hard too!), or producing internal communications and events for our employees. Things happen quickly at Google and to get stuff done here you need to be an enthusiastic team player - a self-starter who can work cross-functionally and isn't frightened to take risks or try out new ways of doing things.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience managing communications in the media, government, or non-profit space with a focus on writing and strategic communications.
  • 2 years of experience supporting C-level communications.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in project management and coordinating content for events.
  • Ability to build effective relationships and influencing leaders. Ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced environments.
  • Ability to work as part of a team and lead efforts across disciplines.
  • Interested in learning about YouTube technology.
  • Excellent attention to detail and creative visual and slide design skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Develop communications strategies for tech executives at YouTube, the tech organization, and specific team initiatives. Produce communications for tech executives, including emails, slides, videos, and talking points.
  • Provide advice to executives that reflects an understanding of their business and leadership style. Develop messaging on complex, nuanced issues.
  • Collaborate extensively with cross-functional teams and communications colleagues.
  • Develop creative strategies for communicating to employees across different functions and offices.
  • Coordinate content and speakers for team-wide events of various sizes and audiences.
title: Internal and Executive Communications Manager, YouTube, Tech
